intro: Eritrichium riae, commonly known as the Sierra velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in mountainous regions. It has a low-growing habit and is often found in open meadows and along stream banks. Eritrichium riae is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its attractive foliage and blooms.
